answerText: Petrarchan Sonnet [or Italian Sonnet; prompt on "sonnet"; do NOT accept or prompt on "Shakespearean sonnet" or "English sonnet"] [10] The Petrarchan Sonnet was introduced into English by translations by Henry Howard, Earl of Surrey and this other Renaissance poet, who allegorized Anne Boleyn as a hind in "Whoso list to hunt".
heading: ACF Regionals |2013 | Editors 2 | 7 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: The first two quatrains in this form are usually rhymed a-b-b-a. For 10 points each:  [10] Name this 14-line form, which is broken into an octave and a sestet.
